div.p:
CHRONOLOGIA SA •••
By the high 〈◊〉 Doctor PHIL. NICOLA 〈◊〉
de regne Christi.
Shortly collected and augmented by Niels Michelſone.

Newly tranſlated out of the German •
and Dence tongue into the Engliſh, By DAVID FORBES.
Pervſed, and accompanied with a ſhort treatiſe and exhortation tending to repentance.

q.p: Repent, for the Kingdome of Heaven is at hand.
Ʋitae finem perpende, de • raſtino haud vllus ſecurus.

div.p: EDINBVRGH Printed by Iohn Wreittoun, 1630.

div.head:
TO THE RIGHT HONOV • ABLE, THE RIGHT REƲE • END AND WORTHY, • H • LORD PROƲEST, BAILIFS MINISTERS, and remnant ••• ſelers of EDINBVRGH: All •••• ſe of grace heere and glor ••
heereafter, &c.

opener.salute: RIght Honourable, right Worthie, renowned Senat, and Paſtors:

div.p:
I Finding my ſelfe ſomewhat bound vnto your benevolent favours, therefore I in minde did decree to giue out the firſt fruits & proofe of my labours, vnder the tuition and defence of your Honourable wiſedomes; and ſeeing I found this briefe and compendious German worke to bee fit for my purpoſe, eſpecially in thoſe tymes when men are moſt ſecure, & ſleeping in worldly vanities, I was in a manner incited, through conſcience
for to lay on my Talent, vnto the benefite of mine owne natiue Countrie, & beeing obliged, for to approue that which I did publickly profeſſe, before your worthie Senat, and within your renowned Citie. Therefore I could ſee none more meete to dedicate the proofe of my labours, as vnto the conspicuous & publicke cenſure of your Honourable Senat: Right Honourable, the Author of this little worke is a German Doctor in divinitie to Hanburgh, Doctor Philip. Nicolaj, now in the LORD, who appearantly hath beene graced, and indued with a gift of prophecie, as experience and event of time, hath teſtified in his travels, & who is the right fundamentall ground of this worke and prophecie, written by him 33. yeares ſince, namely in the yeare of CHRIST 1596, which was found extant preſently after him in Latine, and thereafter tranſlated in the Germane tongue by Mr. Gothard Artus to Da • ſſick, namely in the yeare of CHRIST 1598. whereout a Dence Profeſſor called Niels Michelſone hath
gathered this briefe worke, and tranſlated againe in Dence and Printed lately Anno 1628. The ſubſtance is a briefe analogie of times conferred with Scripture, out of Ezekiell, Daniel, and Revelation of Iohn, containing a Prophecie and ſucceſſe of the Ghospell to the worlds end, & concluded with the Authors protestation, which I thought good to tranſlate, and accompanie with an exhortation to repentance, and benefite mine owne Nation with the ſame. Heerewith perſuading my ſelfe of acceptance, I doe thruſt this poore myte of my travels into the treaſurie of your Chriſtian and charitable dispoſitions, recommending it vnto the protection and tuition of your Honourable wiſdomes, and you and your doings vnto the grace of GOD.

closer.signed: Yours in CHRIST IESVS David Forbes.

div.head: TO The Chriſtian READER.
div.p:
GEntle Reader I haue thought good to benefite thee with this little worke, de regno CHRISTI; and to tranſlate it in our owne commoun language, that it may come in publict view of all: which I haue out of loue and for thy ſpirituall well pervſed: accompanied with a breefe treatiſe, and exhortation to repentance, requeſting thee, as a ſpirituall freind, to cover my weakneſſe and imperfection therein with the vaile of charitable cenſure: but as for the tranſlation it ſelfe, I ſhall approue it before all cenſurs whatſomever: my Maſter may well pretend it not to be decored with the ornate phraſe of language, but yet I hope he muſt ſubſcryue it to be the true tranſlation, according to the German and Dence phraſe it ſelfe, which wee ought receaue in good part, ſeing the Hiſtories and Prophecies
both of Ezekiel, Daniel, and Revelation of Iohn haue (as it were) hitherto beene dark; but now in the end dayly more and more opned and cleared ſo well by faithfull Preachers, as alſo by dayly experience, which the Prophets doe teſtifie clearely, that men ſhall bee enlightned in thoſe myſteries at the end, as you can remark in the Authors warrand for ſearching of the Scriptures, wherein we ſee plainly a ſpeciall illumination of the Spirit, prophecied vnto ſome, for opening of all hid prophecies, and partes of Scripture: yet albeit it is no wayes the Authors meaning abſolutely to determine and appoynt vnto GOD the tyme and end of theſe things, which ſecreete the Father hath reſerved for himſelfe only, as he proteſteth heere in the end, for the yeere, day, and houre wee may not know: but yet of all tokens which our LORD IESUS hath revealed vnto vs, as likewayes the experience of our tymes, conferred and compared with
theſe Prophecies, wee can eaſily diſcerne, that all theſe prophecies are moſt fulfilled; and that the world will ſoone take an end, and therefore ſhould admoniſh vs to haue the lampes of our heartes prepared, that wee may convoy our Brydgroome the LORD IESUS into that bleſſed Heaven of all happineſſe: To whom with the Father, and the holy Ghoſt bee all praiſe and Dominion, AMEN.

closer.signed: Thine in the LORD DAVID FORBES.

div.head: THE AVTHORS WARRAND for ſearching of Scripture.

q.p: BVT thou, O Daniel, ſhut vp the words and ſeale the booke till the end of the time: many ſhall runne to and fro, & knowledge ſhall bee encreaſed.
And hee ſaid, Goe thy way, Daniel: for the words are cloſed vp, and ſealed, till the end of the time.
Many ſhall be purified, made white & tried: but the wicked ſhall do wickedly, & none of the wicked ſhall haue vnderstanding: but the wiſe ſhall vnderstand.
In the latter dayes yee ſhall vnderſtand it plainely.
But in the dayes of the voyce of the ſeventh Angel, when he ſhall beginne to blow the trumpet, even the mysterie of GOD ſhall bee finiſhed, as hee hath declared to his ſervants the Prophets.
And hee ſaid vnto mee, Thou must propheſie againe amongſt the people and nations, and tongues, and to many Kings.

div.head: CHRONOLOGIA SACRA, THE CALLING TYME OF THE IEWES. 41 ½ Yeares.
div.p: YEare after the birth of CHRIST 29 Iohn Baptiſt began to preach repentance, and to baptize.
And in the ſaid yeare began the time of the Iewes mercifull calling, which conteineth in it ſelfe 41 ½. yeares, Apoc. 14.15.
Anno Christi 30. Chriſt was baptized, and then diſcovered himſelfe to the people whom he was, and that by his preaching and miracles.
Anno Chriſti 31 Iohn Baptiſt is caſt in priſon.
Anno Christi 32 he was beheaded.

Anno Christi 34 Christ was crucified,
ſtood vp, and aſcended into Heaven.

div.head: The calling tyme of the Gentils 1600 yeares.
div.p: ANno Chriſti 70 endeth the calling tyme of the Iewes, when their chiefe Citie, and whole policies were deſtroyed to the ground: and in their place goeth on the calling tyme of the Gentils, of the which Christ gathereth now his Church, which mercifull calling of the Gentils indureth 1600 yeares, as it is written in the Revelation chap. 14. verſe 20, and is vnderſtood by the 1600 furlongs: adde vnto this 1600 this 70, ſo is the end of the Gentils calling finiſhed anno Christi 1670.

div.head: Gogs, Magogs, or the Turks Kingdome began anno Christi 335, and indureth 1335 yeares.
div.p:
ANno Chriſti 335, is that evill and damnable heretique Arrius, who for his hereticall learning was excommunicate by a generall aſſemblie; yet to Synodo and Ieruſalem was accepted,
and made free againe with his doctrine, which Arianiſh doctrine was the firſt beginning vnto the Gogs and Mahumets abſurdities, which were accepted and believed in the ruined citie of Ieruſalem: and eſpecially heerefra anno Christi 335, began the Goges 1335 yeares, and endeth anno Christi 1670, Daniel 12. verſe 11.12: and heere is the beginning on that two tymes, and an halfe tyme, Daniel, 12. verſe 7.

Anno Chriſti 366, Damaſius and Vrſatius had great contention and diverſitie about the ſeate of the Pope, heerefra began the tyme of the two witneſſes clothed in Sackcloth, who ſhould prophecie 1260 dayes. Revel. 11 3.

div.head: THE POPES BEGINNING.
div.p:
ANno Christi 410 Rome is taken and burnt by Alaricus King of the Gothes, never was the Citie of Rome vanquiſhed any tyme before, neither given over vnto any ſtranger, and out landiſh, ſince the beginning of the fourth Monarchy, & at that time Sozimus was
Pope, who ardently ſtood after the Occumenick ſtyle, that is, that hee might be called the common and head Biſhop aboue the whole clergie, everie where els through the whole world: This Sozimus gaue ſuch a law that no doings in the Kirke ſhould ſtand in full power without it was approved, and conſented by the Biſhop of Rome, after as it was prophecied that the ſonne of perdition ſhould then begin his governament when the Romane Kingdome began to bow, for certainly that overthrow of the Romanes, which was done by Alaricus, hath beene a beginning hithertill: Therefore that the Papiſtes time which is 1260 yeares, or the 42 months, everie month reckoned to 30 dayes, and everie day for a yeare, hath heere his beginning of this 410 yeares of Chriſt, which 410 yeares added to 1260 the ſumme is 1670. when the Popedome with all things will only take an end.

Anno Chriſti 452. The Hunners King
Attila is come in Italie, who ſpoyled and deſtroyed many Cities, and townes, from this 452 yeares falleth in the Gogs ſecreete dayes whereof Ezek 38.14.

Anno Chriſti 520, Anaſtaſius Emperour began to baniſh and roote out all heriticques, with all their hereticall doctrine, wherevnto the Romane Pope helped with all his vttermoſt power: & which attained vnto a proſperous ſucceſſe; whereby Sathan the father of lyes, and all heriticall doctrine, was bound from this 520 yeares a thouſand yeares. In the which the Dragon that olde ſerpent, which is the Deuill and Sathan, is ſaid to bee bound by the Angel with a great chayne, whereof Apoc. 20.2.

Anno Christi 597 is Gregorius Magnus made Pope, who would not let ſtyle him with the Oecumenick tytle over the Eaſt land, yet nevertheleſſe ſhewed his ambition & avaritiouſneſſe, in this he ſubdued vnder him the Kirks of Spaine and Britaine, to his juriſdiction.
In this yeare Mahumet was 26 yeares old; and then doubtleſſe gaue him ſelfe to reaving and murther. Therefore beginneth the houre, day, moneth, and yeare, whereof Apoc. 9.15.

Anno Chriſti 636, Heereto indureth the time of the Gogs, Now after followeth his tyme Daniel 12.7. and then is Ieruſalem come vnder the Saracines power right in the 300 yeares after the clergie conſented vnto that moſt abſurd learning of Arrius.

Anno Christi 1450, beginneth the new Teſtaments joyfull yeares, and about that time is Conſtantinople with the whole Eaſt-landiſh Kingdome, and Emperordome ſubdued by the Turkes and becommeth the Gogiers ſtall and ſtinking denne. Heere beginneth the 7 angelicall months, which the Scripture giveth vnto Gogs ſprituall burials Ezek- 39.11.
Anno Chriſti 1522. Heereto endureth the ſet tymes, now after followeth the halfe time Dan. 12.7.

This ſame yeare Doctor Martin Luther went to Wormes, and anſwered his cauſe before the Emperour. In the meane tyme Caroloſtadius made vprore, and ſtormed to Wittenbergh, and the locuſts came vp, of the which Apocal. 9. verſe. 3.4.5.
Anno Christi 1625. heere endeth the 1290 yeares, whereof Daniel ſpeaketh in his 12 chap. verſe 11. and the 45 yeares beginneth heere.

Right ſo endeth the ſame yeare the yeare of the two witneſſes, which when they are ended, then ſhall the Pope in-arme himſelfe with his greateſt power, and that ſhall bee his greateſt tyranny, which ſhall ſtand three yeares and an halfe, Apocal. 11.9. vntill anno Chriſti 1629, in the which yeare the ſpirituall tyme beginneth, which ſhall continue 41 yeares and an halfe.
Anno Christi 1663, the 7 moneths haue their end.
Anno Chriſti 1664, the laſt 7 yeares begin, of the which Ezek. 39.9.12.14.

But anno Chriſti 1670, then haue all the yeares which the Prophets haue ſpoken of their only end, both the Heathen, Gogs, and Popes, as afterwards the Author himſelfe cleareth, yet his proteſtation excepted, that he will not preceeſlie determine ſuch things; but referreth tyme, and houre into the Fathers owne hands.

div.head: A ſhort interpretation, and clearing of the regiſter of the new Testament.

argument.p: THE whole age of the New Teſtament, according to the meaning of the Prophets, are divided in 4 times.
The firſt is the calling time of the Iewes.
The ſecond is the Gentiles 1600 furlongs.
The third is Gogs, Mahumets, or Turkes tyme.
The fourth is, the Popes tyme.

div.head: The firſt: Namely, the called time of the Iewes.
div.p: VVEE read in the booke of the Revelation 14. v. 15, is cryed and ſaid, THE TIME IS COME TO REAPE.

Now is a time or an houre, the foure and twentieth part of a whole day: night and day reckoned to 24 houres. An Heavenly day conteineth a thouſand yeares, as it is written 2 Pet. 3. v. 8. (a thouſand yeares as a day) divide this 1000 with 24, ſo commeth there about 41 yeeres and an halfe.

Remarke now the groundleſſe mercie of the Almightie GOD, how he did viſite and call his people the Iewes, of the ſeede of Abraham, and offered them his grace by Iohn the Baptist, who began his calling with the preaching of repentance; and Baptiſme, in the 29 yeare or thereby, after the birth of Ieſus Christ, of the Virgin Marie: which mercifull calling of the Iewes, Chriſt with his Diſciples continued after the beheading of Iohn the Baptiſt vnto one or two and fourtie yeares, and did begin
in Ieruſalem, and gaue them time eneugh of repentance, in the ſpace of this 41 yeares, but when they remained in their hardneſſe, and condemned Gods Sonne, the bleſſed ſeede, which particularlie, and eſpecially was promiſed them in Abraham, and ſo wittingly proceded in their ſinne, againſt the holy Ghoſt. Then GOD tooke his ſcourge in hand, Titus Ʋespaſian, and therewith ſtrooke them ſo hard, in the end of this 41 yeares, or 41 and an halfe yeares after the beginning of Iohns preaching, which was Anno Christi, 29. ſo that Ieruſalem their head Citie is deſtroyed, and their whole polices vndergone, and never ſhall come vp againe. Lay now together 29 with 41, ſo commeth thereof 70. Namely, in the ſame yeare after the birth of CHRIST, in the which yeare Titus deſtroyed Ieruſalem, and the policies of the Iewes, and this is the time of the Iewes calling Apocal. 14.15.

div.head:
The other tyme of the New Teſtament: namely, the Gentils, which ſhould indure 1600 yeares.
SACRA,
div.p: AFter as the Iewes, GODS owne people, had contemned his Fatherly offerings of grace, in his Sonne IESUS CHRIST, and would not accept of grace, yet GOD would haue his glorious Kingdome after this lyfe repleniſhed, and therefore by his Word, Sacraments, and powerfull preſence of his Spirit, ordaineth heere in the world a Kingdome of grace for poore Gentils, that were not of Abrahams bleſſed ſeede as the Iewes, which Kingdome of grace ſhould reach it ſelfe out 1600 furlongs, as it is written Apocal. 14 19.20, with which furlongs are vnderſtood yeares, as heereafter ſhall bee ſpoken of.

This 1600 furlongs, stadia, or yeares, which remaineth now againe for the Heathens to repent; and thereby to be in gathered in the Kingdome of grace, that they thereafter ſhould inherite his Kingdome of glory, and there ſee him as he is.

In this 1600 yeares the third Angell rypeth the vyneyard, as Iohn ſayeth, and caſteth it in the great winepreſſe of GODS wrath: and the winepreſſe was troden without the citie, and blood came out of the winepreſſe vnto the horſe brydels, by the ſpace of 1600 furlongs. Revel. 14.19.20.

The three Angels with the Sonne of man that ſate on the white clowd, is, GOD Father, Sonne, and holy Ghoſt: Revel. 14.14. GODS Sonne is called the Sonne of man, for the humane nature hee hath taken vnto the vnion and vnſeparabilitie of his perſon, the heavenly Temple, verſe 15. the Heavenly Altar, verſe 18: the white clowd, v. 14. ſignifieth all one; namely, the ſame man IESUS CHRIST, In whom dwelleth the fulneſſe of the Godhead bodily. Coloſſ. 2.9.

The wyne grapes in the 18 verſe that are caſt in the preſſe of the wrath of GOD, are the Iewes, who were ſo preſſed by Titus Ʋespaſian, that there
were ſlaine eleven hundreth thouſand Iewes, as Ioſephus writeth, lib. 7.

Theſe who were preſſed without the citie, verſe 20, and without the townes communitie, who were Burgeſſes and indwellers, Christ advertiſing them, they liſtned, and gaue eare to his advertiſement, who departed in ſafetie vnto Pella: in the meane tyme the other wyne grapes were preſſed by the armie of Titus.

The blood that ranne from the preſſe betokneth, that the wrath of GODS vengeance ſhould reach without Ieruſalem, and ſtreatch it ſelf vnto ſuch contemners of GOD, and hardned ſinners, and that vnto 1600 furlongs, that is, 1600 yeares.

The horſe vnto whoſe brydles the blood ran, betokeneth the furious and vntamed Heathen, and tyrants, that ſet them-ſelves vp againſt CHRISTS Kirk. Pſal. 2. Which tyrants are like Horſe & Mules, in whom are no knowledge of ſalvation. Pſal. 32.9. who
ſhould bee caſt in the great preſſe of the wrath of GOD, vntill ſo long they let tame them by the brydle of the Evangel, and let them bee teached and ſhowne by the ſervants of the Word, to ſerue the LORD, and kiſſe the Sonne. Pſal. 2.10.11.12.
With 1600 Stadia, or furlongs is not vnderſtood, the length of place, but of tyme wherevnto is given three cauſes.

Firſt: CHRIST ſaith, (Luke. 21.24) That Ieruſalem ſhall bee troden vnder the feete of the Gentiles, vntill the time of the Gentiles bee fulfilled: Heere ſpeaketh IESUS of the Gentiles, that they ſhould haue a time, and that the Gentiles tyme ſhould beginne when Ieruſalem was deſtroyed, which time of the Gentiles is not found written in no place of the holy Scripture, how long it ſhall endure except only in this place. Secondly: This ſecret of 1600 ſtadia if it ſhould be vnderſtood according to the letter, and as the words are in themſelues: then this 1600 stadia or furlongs,
maketh no more than 50 myles: but now the cup of GODS wrath hath powred it ſelfe more at large than 50 myles about Ieruſalem: yea in all the corners of the whole earth: therefore this 1600 ſtadia, is not vnderſtood of the place, but of the tyme.

Thirdly: It is commonly the forme of the holy Ghoſt, that he opneth appointed tymes, (definita tempora) with ſome dark kynd of ſpeach. Daniel 4. he calleth the ſeven yeares, ſeven tymes. Ezek. 4. Dan. 9. hee giveth to vnderſtand yeares with dayes. Ezek. 47.3.4.5. there is meaſured 4000 cubits, vntill the Evangelicall fiſhing, where vndoubtedly is vnderſtood with 4000 cubits 4000 yeares: namely, from the firſt promiſe of the womans ſeede, vntill the Evangelicall fiſhing beganne with the fiſhers of IESUS CHRIST: The holy Apoſtles heereof can be vnderſtood in this place, with 1600 stadia, right ſo many yeares.

So indureth the Heathings appoynted
tyme after this calculation vntill the Sonne of man come in his white clowd, who with his Angels will reape and gather the children of men, the good and fruitfull grapes in his owne citie, but will cutte off the wyld grapes with his ſharp ſickle till the 1670 yeares.

div.head: The third tyme of the New Testament: Namely, Gogs, Magogs, or Mahumets, and Turkes Kingdome: and that for the space 1335. yeares, which is ended anno Chriſti 1670. according to the prophecie of Daniel. 12. v. 12. and Dan. 7. ver. 8.
div.p:
IN the foreſaid chapters of Daniel is written, that this little horne of Gogs or Mahumets, which came vp with a little beginning, and ſtoode vp amongſt the ten hornes, the ten Kingdomes of the Romiſh Monarchs who did plucke away three of the firſt horns, and held warres againſt the Sanctuarie, and was for them too ſtrong, verſe. 11 This little horne came vp Anno Chriſti 335: when that Arianiſh hereſie ſpred foorth in denying of the Godhead of
IESVS CHRIST, in that publicke aſſemblie of Biſhops, and learned till Synodo, of all was conſented and approved, and that in the ruined Citie of Ieruſalem, which falſe doctrine of Arius was the firſt cauſe, and beginning, till Gogs and Mahumets ſucceſſe in the world: ſo ſhall the end of this Gogs, Magogs, or Turkes, and Mahumets fall, after this calculation in the yeare 1670. for 1335 added vntill 335. makes in ſumme 1670.

Secondly: There is written in the Revelalion 9. verſe 14. of the foure Angels that were bound in the river Euphrates: that they ſhould bee made lowſe, which were prepared at one houre, at one day, at one moneth, and at one yeare to ſlaye the third part of men, which doubleſſe is vnder ſtood of the Mahumets tyrannie, which he executed on the poore Chriſtians in the Eaſt Lands, and how he changed lawes, and times: for Euphrates flood is not farre from Babylon. The foure Angels
that are ſaid to bee bounde in this flood, or the foure Patriarchs in the Eaſt land, the one to Conſtantin, the other to Antiochia, the third to Ieruſalem, the fourth to Alexandria, which foure helped, and much aſſiſted the Kingdome of the ſonne of perdition. Theſe are ſaid to bee louſed, and many wayes ſpred abrode, and that by the hereſie of Arius and Neſtorius, concerning the abſurd doctrine of CHRISTS perſon, that when they had conſented in the ſame hereſie, then are they forced to giue themſelves vnder Mahumet, and then were prepared till the houre, day, moneth and yeare, to ſlay the third part of men. Let now one houre bee the 24 part of one heavenly day which continueth almoſt 42 yeares, for one whole day is reckoned for a thouſand yeares: the Heavenly moneth 30 yeares ſpace, this yeare being a common yeare: ſo extendeth the ſumme 1073. yeares.

Now when the end falleth in Anno Christi 1670 then is the beginning anno Christi
579, in the which tyme, as the Gothers that were in Spaine turned from that Arianiſh, and Mahumetiſh doctrine, which then long tyme was allowed and approved of the foure Patriarchs: and therewith tooke ſuch an end, that Mahumet troade himſelfe, who till in this 597 yeares was in the bloome of his youth, about 26 yeares of age: Moreover in this ſame yeare the Popes ambition ſhew it ſelfe, and avaritious flood Euphrates in the Pope Gregorius Magnus, who ſent his Ambaſſadors in England, and by power of an armie forced them to imbrace the Romiſh religion: In like manner the Pope had the victorie aboue the Churches of Spaine.

Thirdly: Ezekiel chap. 39. verſe 11 doth prophecie, that GOD ſhall giue Gog a buriall place towards the Eaſt, which ſhall be called the valley of the multitude of Gog, where Gog with his armies ſhall be buried, and cleanſe the land in ſeven moneths, and ſhall burne
off their weapons, and put the ſhields and bucklers vpon bowes, and vpon arrowes with fire ſeven yeares, verſe 9. when there is made of the ſeven Angelicall moneths Angelicall dayes, 30 dayes in everie moneth, and dayes to the yeare, ſo commeth of it 210 yeares: adde vnto this ſeven yeares, in the which the weapons were burnt in, Summa 217 yeares: Let now the end of this 217 yeares fall in 1670, and then 217 ſubſtracted from this 1670, the beginning falleth anno 1453. In the which tyme Mahumet 11 of the name tooke in Constantinople, and made heerewith an end of the Romiſh Emperourdome in the Eaſt land: ſo is then Conſtantinople Gogs buriall place, and the valley of the multitude of the Gogs, or that place Hamona, verſe 16, that lyeth toward the Eaſt vnto the ſea, verſe 11, which Conſtantinople is not longer the Chriſtians head citie in the Eaſtland, as before; but Gogs denne, and ſpirituall dead ſtinking graue of the
Mahumets.

That theſe armour arrowes ſhould burne ſeven yeares, ſignifieth that the Mahumetiſh lawes, ſtatutes, ceremonies, Kirkes ſervice, and deceate ſhould be burnt to nothing, by the fire of the true ſpirituall word of GOD.
This is now of Gogs, Mahumets, and Turks Kingdome, how long it will indure: namely, as long as the tyme of the New Teſtament indureth.

div.head: The fourth tyme of the New Teſtament: namely, the Popes.
div.p:
IN the booke of the Revelation, 13 chap. there is written of the ſeven headed beaſt, that it ſhould continue 42 moneths, that is, the Popedome to Rome ſhall indure 42 moneths. Rome is builded on ſeven heads, high toppes, and mountaines: Make monethes to dayes 30 dayes in everie moneth, and reckon every day for a yeare, ſo proceedeth 1260 yeares, when the end of this 1260 yeares falleth in anno Chriſti
1670. and then beginneth the ſame 1260 yeares, anno Chriſti 410: from which tyme hitherto Rome hath had the empyre and victory almoſt over all the borders of the Iewes: then firſt ſubdued and taken in by Alaricus King of the Gothes, then began the firſt Romiſh Monarchie to be feeble, and begate weake legges.

Now when ſuch wayes the policies and mightie government of Rome began to diminiſh, then began the Romiſh Antichriſt to increaſe in the government of the Church, and the Pope tooke vnto himſelfe the power, and ſuperioritie aboue the whole world, in all Churches, and clergie, even as the Apoſtle Paul had prophecied before 2 Theſſ. 2. v. 6 ſaying ſo. And now yee know what withholdeth that hee might bee revealed in his tyme: namely, that man of ſinne, and ſonne of perdition, ſetteth himſelfe againſt: verſe. 7. For the misterie of iniquitie doeth already worke, onely hee which now withholdeth
ſhall let, till he be taken out of the way: which Pauls prophecie, Chriſostomus, and many others vnderſtood this of the Romiſh Monarchy, & Emperourdome, which then hindred the ſonne of perdition, and man of ſinne his ambition, that he could not come vp as he would: and which could not bee done, vntill the time, the ſame Imperium and Emperourdome began to bow, which was accompliſhed by Alaricus King of the Gothes.

II. In the Revelation 18, Iohn heareth of proud Babylon, whoſe plagues, death, and ſorrows ſhall one day fall vpon her. verſe 8, and in an houre ſhall her judgment bee, verſe 10, And in an houre ſhall the deſolation of her riches come. verſe 17. And in an houre ſhall bee made deſolate. verſe 19. So will GOD then powre his wrath on the ſeed of the Romanes in one day, & 3 houres. Now one day is 1000 yeares, one hour 41 and an halfe yeares, adde together, ſo is the ſumme 1124. and an halfe yeares,
when this 1124. and a half yeares endeth An. Christi 1670. then falleth their beginning in Anno Chriſti 546. in the which time, that the Gothers King Totilias, that ſaid himſelfe to be the ſcourge of GOD, ſet fire in Rome, and brunt the greateſt part thereof. From this 546 yeare of Chriſt, vntill Luther departed in the Lord, is likewiſe 1000 yeares one Heavenly day, for he died Anno Christi 1546. and is that day of the which before: therefrom and till 1588, when as the Papiſts contracted themſelves againſt England, and there gote a terrible defeate, went out the firſt houre of the three, therefrom and till Anno Chriſti 1629. When as the Papiſts tyrannie ſhall bee weakned, and muſt vnder-goe, and the two witneſſes ſhall come on feete againe, is the other houre from 1629. vntill 1670. is the third houre, when all things will ſeeme to take their only end.

III. In the Revelation 9. The Apoſtle ſeeth, a ſtarre which had the key
of the bottomleſſe pit, and was fallen downe from Heaven on the earth, wherewith nothing is vnderſtood, except only this ſonne of perdition, who opned the bottomleſſe pit. v. 2. whereout there aroſe much hereticall ſmoake damp and reeke, which darkned the righteous beames of the Sunne of IESUS CHRIST, and his Evangelicall doctrine, and out of that ſmoke came Locuſtes on the earth, v. 3. Wherewith is vnderſtood the peſtilentious heretickes and falſe teachers, who doe nothing els but bring in amongſt the ground & ſeede of the Chriſtian Kirk the greateſt miſchiefe. Theſe damnable locuſts (faith Iohn) ſhall vexe the people 5 moneths, that is, 150 Heavenly dayes or yeares: for fiue tymes thirtie is 150, when this 150 yeares taketh their end, anno Christi 1670. then the calculation concludeth that they begin anno 1521. In the which tyme that Caroloſtadius wakned vp that great vprore, with ſtorming of images, from whence proceeded
in the Churches diverſities of opinions.

Fourthly: In the Revelation, chap. 11. we reade of the two witneſſes, clothed in ſackcloth, who prophecied 1260 dayes: and when 1260 dayes endeth, then they ſhall bee killed by the beaſt, and three dayes and an halfe ly vnburied, but thereafter ſhall haue lyfe of the Spirit, and aſcend to the clowdes of Heaven, and the enemies of the Evangell ſhall behold it; then ſhall there be a great Earthquake, which ſhall continue an houre, in the which Earthquake the tenth part of Babylon ſhall fall. By the two witneſſes is vnderſtood the old and new Teſtament, which beareth witneſſe of the trueth in murning weede and ſackcloth, that is, vnder croces and perſecution: If wee will adde and lay together with this three and an halfe dayes, or three and an halfe commoun yeares, the heavenly houre namely 41 an and half yeares, then is the ſumme 1305, then followeth it the beginning of this 1305, to bee Anno
Chriſti 365 on the which tyme that Damaſius & Ʋrſicinus did contend to Rome for the Popedome, which of them ſhould bee Pope, who carried a bloody warre in the holy houſe againſt others. And then hath this ſonne of perdition gotten his kingdome, conſecrated and anoynted vnto him by murther, and ſhedding of much blood. When wee begin from the foreſaid yeare Anno Christi 365, to reckon to the 1260, then end they juſt Anno Chriſti 1625. Now how thoſe two witneſſe the Old and New Teſtament with all true preachers, who hath holden with thoſe two witneſſes, hath beene killed and rent, it is eneugh knowne vnto all men, for not onlie Papiſts, but all other ſects rent ſo on thoſe two witneſſe, and ſo killeth them, everie one to turne and revert them vnto his owne hereticall meaning, which is eneugh knowne vnto everie true Chriſtian, but now moſt of all thoſe two witneſſes are now killed with their confederats in this 3 and an halfe
yeares: Namely, from Anno 1625 vntill Anno Chriſti. 1629. whereof the well learned man Maſter Meynelaus Poulſone Preacher to the Caſtell of Copemanhaven, hath ſet out on our Dens tongue the foreſaid Philippi Nicolai his words which likewiſe I will rehearſe following in this manner.

div.head: Comment. de regno CHRISTI, lib. 2. capit. 2. fol. 6. 196. ſequent.
div.p:
SEing now the holy BIBLE is tranſlated in Engliſh, French, Dutch, Dence; and other tongues and languages: and is vſed and reade with all diligence, both of learned and vnlearned: So vnderſtandeth the Pope, that Scotiſh Engliſh, Fleames, Dence, Norwiſh, Swedens, Poles, Bohemiſh, and Ʋngariſh; with no deceate or ſubtilitie can bee brought againe vnder his power, ſo long as the bookes of the old and new Teſtament haue the vpper hand: and therefore he ſhall ſtriue after alſo to take from theſe two witneſſes all their prerogatiue, and bring ſo to paſſe, that
they may haue no place in the Roman Church; but to loſſe their ſhine altogether, and by the permiſſion of GOD, ſeing Godlineſſe is verie rare beſides vs, ſo can it lightly event, that the Romiſh Antichriſt ſhall haue once ſucceſſe.

This proud and diveliſh victorie will continue three yeares and an half, which is from the yeere 1625. vntill 1629, ſo long ſhall the Chriſtian Kirk indure this perſecution, and ſhed her blood in great quantitie, for confeſſing of the trueth: and together in theſe tymes men ſhall ſee the bookes of the old and new Teſtament to be whole contemned, and to ly as dead bodies in the ſtreetes, and they ſhall bee troade with feete, yet ſome godly compaſſioners, and the Evangeliſh true confeſſors ſhall not ſuffer them to be whole buried. But thereafter from anno 1629 vntill anno 1670, the whole heavenly houre, or fourtie one yeares and a halfe, ſo ſhall kyth it ſelfe, that the holy
Scripture, and holy miniſter calling, with the two witneſſes, which is the old and new Teſtament, ſhall powerfully come before againe, and with great jubileren, and eſpeciall joyfull crying, compaſſe about the godly, and aſcend vp into the clowdes of Heaven. Apoc. 11. ver. 12. this ſhall bee a great honour and glory, and can not bee hindered. This the Papiſts ſhall ſee, and over all meaſure therethrough bee terrified, ſeing they can not troade more the holy Bible vnder their feete; neither turne the people with their anathemata, or curſe and cruell perſecution, from the diligent reading, and godly meditation: yea, there ſhall be ſuch a great Earthquake, ſo that the tenth part of the great citie, Apocal. 11. ver. 13 that is, the ten Kingdomes of the Papiſticall dominions ſhall condiſcend together: namely, the Germanians, Hungarians, Bohemians, Polonians, Swedens, Dence, Norwiſh, Engliſh, Scottiſh, and French, who ſhall be moved, and ſhall
knit themſelues together, and wholly denunce themſelues off from the Papiſts: yea, they ſhall hold together with ſuch a ſpeciall zeale, and that for the cruell perſecution of the Chriſtians, as likewiſe for the cauſe of the vntolerable pride of the Romane Antichriſt: And ſhall fall in Italie or Welſhland with mightie power, and burne vp with fire that great Citie Rome, great Babylon, Revel. 18. verſe 8. That Babylons whoore can bee payed, and get her right rewarde, who tyrannouſlie hath perſecuted the ſpirituall members of Chriſts bodie, Revel. 17. verſe. 6. and drunke her ſelfe drunke with the blood of Saincts, and blood of the Martyres of IESVS. And that there can come ſuch a reward vpon her, as on Ieruſalem, who ſlew CHRIST IESUS himſelfe, and is come ſince the beginning on all perſecuters of CHRISTS Church.

After this tyme is the heavenly houre 41 and an halfe yeares, whoſe end
are fulfilled anno Chriſti 1670.

Heerewith it aggreeth with that which our foreſaid author ſetteth in his expoſition, of the 12. chapter of Daniel, lib. 2. de regno Christi. pag. 121. ſaying, It may bee that Anno Christi 1625. will come vp ſome new Motus, and tumult, that the Chriſtiſtian Church will ſuffer cruell ſorrowfull tempeſts againe, but how it ſhall bee Daniel cleareth not, except that which hee heareth of the Angel, bleſſed are they that waiteth thereafter: that is, who are patient as yet, vntill the 45 yeare are paſt.

Now everie one knoweth that patience is no wayes without croſſes and ſorrowes, whereby may bee judged that Anno 1625, there will burſt out a hole on a diveliſh and peſtilentious byle, which now Anno Christi 1596, when Philip Nicolai wrote this booke, the enemies of the true Chriſtians, are making rype, in their ſecret counſels and concealed pratickes, that the Elect
may be weary of thoſe troublous times.

Wherefore of this ineluctabilis and future tyme of ſorrows ſhall come on that tyme: vntill the which wee haue as yet from this yeare 1579 28 yeare, then ſhould the ſoules of true Chriſtians, after the counſell of Daniel, prepare theſelues to patience: and heerewith remember this cruell perſecution, ſhall not for ever indure, but ſhall vndergoe, within a ſhort ſpace, and come to an end within few yeares, And therefore eſpecially ſhould wee pray GOD, that hee from Heaven will ſend vs the ſtrength of his ſpirit, that wee could grow in true faith, and ſtand conſtant in the revelation of the trueth.

V. And moreover this vndoubtedly agrieth well, namely, this laſt tyme of the new Teſtament, with the tymes that proceeded before the flood came, ſeing that CHRIST prophecieth hereof himſelfe. Math. 24. & Luk 17. That right as it was in the world before the flood, the people gaue themſelues
to drunkenneſſe, filthineſſe and luſtes of the fleſh, and that vntill the ſame day that Noah entred into the Arke: So likewiſe the people ſhould giue themſelues ſecure vnto ſuch vices againſt the laſt tymes.

Seing there is now reckoned from the worlds beginning vnto the flood 1657 yeares: ſubſtract 1657 from 1670 ſo haſt thou againe 13 yeares, when CHRIST was 12 yeares, and in his 13 when hee diſputed with the learned in the Temple of Ieruſalem.
Lay now together the firſt Adam with the ſecond, and then the earthly with the Heavenly.
1. The firſt had earthly Paradice, the other the Temple of Hieruſalem, and that after the commandement of his Heavenly Father: Shall I not be about my Fathers buſineſſe, Luke 2. ver. 49.
2. As Adam ſhew obedience vnto GOD in Paradice, ſo did the other in the Temple.

3. Adam was counſelled of the woman,
that hee ſhould eate of the tree of the forbidden fruite: CHRIST could not be counſelled of his mother to deſiſt from that which was his Fathers.

4. As from Adams fall vntill the flood proceeded 1657 yeares, likewayes from Chriſts actiue obedience (obedientiae activae specimine) example which he ſhew in the Temple, when he was 12 yeares full, and in his 13, vntil the only end and revelation of tyme will proceede 1657 yeares: adde heerevnto the 13 yeares of his age, ſo falleth in the end anno Chriſti 1670.

V. And for the laſt, it is neither to diſ-allow betweene the agreement of the yeares of Chriſts age, that he lived & converſed viſibly in this world with ſo many of the New Teſtaments jubile, every commoun jubile yeare reckoned to 49, Levit. 25. ver. 8. for 7 tymes 7, maketh 49. the next following 50 yeare was both a jubile yeare, and the firſt yeare to begin in: in the next following jubile yeares reckning. Now
