is Christ dead, riſen, and aſcended in the 34 yeares of his age: begin now to tell theſe jubile yeares, from the 29 yeare of CHRISTS age, for then began Iohn the Baptiſt to ſounde with the trumpet of the new Teſtament, ſo falleth in this 34. this new Teſtaments jubile yeares, beginning Anno Chriſti 1646 from this, to 1670, is about 25 yeare, an halfe jubile yeare, becauſe CHRIST liued not out his 34 yeares.
Now to a concluſion of this little booke, I will bring in two prophecies of our Authors.

div.head: I. Of the diminiſhing of CHRISTS Church against the worlds end. Pag. 223.
div.p:
THIS may well bee, that as Chriſt did not ſhow himſelfe after his reſurrection to the vnthankfull Iewes preiſts, and Scribes in Ieruſalem, but remoued North vnto Galile, and there revealed himſelfe before his diſciples: ſo in like manner, that the cleare learning
of the Evangel, which once is driven from ſome parts in Dutchland, and Romiſh dominions, ſhall not come their againe: in the ſame places, but make his dwelling away, North in Germanie, and in other Northlandiſh places, in Scotland, Norway, Sweden, Iſeland, &c.

And as CHRIST after his reſurrection preached not, and learned publictly in Hieruſalem where he was crucified, but ſecreetly revealed himſelfe to his diſciples, who were gathered within locked doores for feare of the Iewes: ſo that in like manner before the • aſt day, the Heavenly ſinceere doctrine • n Churchs and ſchooles from whence ſhe is baniſhed, not more there to haue ſuch ſucceſſe, but ſhall ſound quietly within ſome poore folkes doores, who ſhall reade the holy BIBLE in their • ouſes, with Luthers Catechiſme and E
• iſtles, and other writings of true • earned teachers, and with their houſe
• old profite themſelues in the exerciſe
of true religion.

div.head: What ſucceſſe Spaine hath to exspect heere in the Sownd. pag. 99. lib. 1. circa finem. cap. 2.
div.p: IF Spaine out of ambition, for augmenting of his kingdome come in our ſeas, and will ſtay or hinder the handling and merchandiſe of the Engliſh, Dence, Swedens and Muſcoviters, vnto the damnage of the Norwiſh dominions, then it ſhall not proſper with him, he may try much, but carrie nothing home, but ſhame and diſcommoditie with him.

This is now briefly ſet foorth and extracted by the honourable and inlightned Doctor Philip Nicolaus, which is taken out of his ſecond booke of the Kingdome of IESUS CHRIST, concerning a prophecie of the worlds end.

If any heereby will conclude, that the laſt day preciſly ſhould fall in this 1670, and thinke heereby that I ſhould preſume more than the holy Scripture
giveth place. Therevnto I anſwere (ſaith the Author) in this manner, Of that day and houre no man knoweth; yea, not the Angels in Heaven, ſaith CHRIST, Math. 24.42. Mark. 13.32. For this cauſe I proteſt heere, and doe witneſſe, that I Philip Nicolaus will know nothing of the myſteriall things, which GOD hath preſerved only for himſelfe in ſecreete, and will haue no man to know it, neither decree this nor deny this: it may well bee that the laſt day giue himſelfe to know in the ſame 1670 yeares, it may likewayes bee thereafter, as the people leaſt thinke of, and living in their fleſhly luſtes and appetites, that the ſame day ſtealeth ſuddenly over them, it may well bee that the laſt day commeth ſooner for the cauſe of the elect, who fervently and heartfully think long thereafter, that they could once atteine an happie end of all ſinne, and of all their ſorrow, which both the world, and the Divell afflicteth them
with: for that which GOD hath preſerved in ſecreete for himſelfe, it becommeth vs not to ſearch therein: and therefore I abyde alone by the revealed word, and the holy propheticall and Apoſtolicall writings, what the events are on the laſt day is found written after GODS owne commandement, Revel. 11. ver. 11. and ver. 19. and chap. 10. ver. 11. which I in the feare of GOD red with great diligence, and deepe meditation, heerewith praying the Almightie GOD, who hath ſpoken by his holy Prophets, and Apoſtles mouth, that hee for his godly goodneſſe, mercifully will aſſiſt ſome of his true Chriſtians, to reveile and cleare the ſecret myſterie of tymes, that are written in Ezekiel, Daniel and Revelation. Therefore when I ſee narrowlie vnto the Heavenly Evangelicall harveſt, the Heavenly houre, and heavenly Stadia, or furlongs: then I can not otherwayes as preciſlie conſider & meditate of the revealed times, if
wee will reckone over the involued things which are infolded in the holy BYBLE: yet nowayes concluded heereby, what ſhall follow heereafter. Where fore this that I write heere, I ſet them not as Articles of beleefe, but onely as the thing that a Chriſtian ſhould deſire and ſeeke after, recommending this vnto the event of tyme: ſeing there is no ſurer interpretation, and clearing of Prophecies as when they are fulfilled.

O everlaſting good GOD, the ſpring of all wiſedome and grace, inlighten our ſpirits and darke vnderſtanding, with the light and clearneſſe of thy godly wiſdome, with the ſpring and fire of fervent charitie, that in vs all worldly vanities, luſtes of the fleſh and ſpring of pryde, may bee extinguiſhed and quenched by the holy lampe of thy light, and that wee may rejoyce in our onelie and moſt excellent Iewell that thou hath given vs, namely, our onely Saviour and Redeemer
and bee true obeyers all the dayes of our lyfe, yea in the midſt of death: to whom with thee, and the holy Ghoſt be praiſe and Glorie for ever Amen.

div.head: A BRIEFE TREATISE AND EXHORTATION TO REPENTANCE.

q.p: Repent, for the Kingdome of Heaven is at hand.

div.p:
IN this booke we may ſee the long patience and ſuffering of GOD, towards his owne people the Iewes, who in the laſt tymes of their viſitation, did ſend his owne Sonne, the Saviour of mankynd, and that of the ſeede of Abraham, to ſtretch foorth his hands and armes, to ſaue and imbrace the remnant of the loſt ſheepe of the houſe of Iſrael: but when they did contemne Gods Fatherly viſitation, and were offended with CHRIST IESUS, & had crucified the King of Glorie, as lykewayes thereafter did perſecute in the ſame manner all his diſciples, Apoſtles, and ſervants
of GOD: then GOD left them, and gaue them over vnto themſelues, and did begin his mercifull calling with the Gentiles, who were ſtrangers and aliants from the houſe of Iſrael. By whoſe viſitation likewiſe, wee may learne of the mercie and juſtice of God: for thoſe Gentiles of Aſia, and Eaſtlandiſh Dominions, haue had their owne tymes of GODS mercifull viſitation, but after many ſinnes committed, together with the perſecution of ſaincts, and contempt of the word, GOD hath removed his Candleſtickes from them, and hath given them over vnto vanities, and lyes, and is gone from them, and now in this laſt houre and tyme of the world, it hath pleaſed him to erect his Church, and candleſticke within this Nation: And there fore, O happie, and thryſe happie are wee, if wee will acknowledge the tymes of our mercifull viſitation, and day of our calling, for the LORD of
glorie is ſtanding at the doore of our ſoules: and within this Nation wee haue had our owne tymes, where GOD hath knocked long with the hammers of his Word: and appearantly ſeing the word is contemned, and beareth no fruite in mens conſciences and converſations, that GOD is departing from vs vnto another people, and yet ſtreatching foorth his armes, and calling vnto him all true Chriſtians, who will turne vnto him and repent them of their ſinnes, for certainly there is no ſinne which hath abounded in thoſe forraine Churches, but thoſe and more doth abound beſides vs, and giue the Church and Sainctes of GOD within this Nation bee not perſecuted with publict Tyrants, yet let the wiſe Chriſtian ſee how ſhee is perſecuted, rent, and divided within her ſelfe, which doeth prognoſticate a fearefull departure of our kynd GOD, and a terrible judgement to hang over our heads, and would to God I ſay that our judgement
bee not worſe of all, if we take not heede in tyme: Therefore let vs bee wiſe, and learne of the figge tree, and of theſe tokens, to prepare our ſelues for our Bridegroome the LORD IESUS ſecond comming in the clowdes.

Iohn the Baptist a forerunner of the Meſſias, the firſt trumpet of the Ghoſpell, is heere crying out, according to the Prophecie of Iſaiah, Prepare the wayes of the LORD, make his pathes ſtreight, againſt the first comming of the Meſſias. Amend your liues for the Kingdome of grace is at hand, and is to bee offered in the LORD IESUS to everie true penitent, and belieuer of the Ghoſpell. Now in thoſe dayes our onely high Prieſt and Prophet, is crying vnto vs, and learning vs by the Parable of the figge tree in the Ghoſpell, that the Kingdome of glorie is at hand. Mat. 24.32. And that wee ſhould lift vp our heads, working our ſalvation in feare and trembling, waitting for the day of the LORD, for he
beeing the firſt trumpet of the Ghoſpell in thoſe dayes, his onely matter and aime was, in reſpect of the great defection, and diverſitie of religion amongſt the Iewes: as likewiſe their true worſhip of God, was turned into a Phariſaicall and ſelfe loue of themſelves; therefore hee was buſie preparing the firſt way and comming of the LORD, and importing vnto them a Kingdome of grace to bee at hand, and therefore did exhort them vnto repentance, that they might enter and goe in into that Church militant heere on earth by this Kingdome of grace, now to bee offered, and reveiled vnto them in the Meſſias, that thereafter they might bee found worthie againſt the ſecond comming of the Lord, to enter into the Church triumphant, and Kingdome of glorie..

Our Iohn the Baptiſts, and preachers in our tymes, haue greater occaſion, yea all preaching ſtooles whatſoever, being now the laſt trumpets of
the Ghoſpell, haue matter enough to cry out in thoſe words: Repent for the Kingdome of Heaven is at hand: even that Kingdome of glorie, where the Meſſias is not in his firſt comming, in the lykeneſſe of a ſervant, and in the baſeneſſe of his fleſh, to offer more the Kingdome of grace and mercie, in errecting a Church militant heere on earth, as in the dayes of Iohn the Baptiſt: But now certainly comming in his ſecond comming in the clouds, convoyed of all the Angels, and trowpes of HEAVEN, as a powerfull judge, in full majeſticall glorie, to rander everie man according to his workes, where grace and mercie ſhall ceaſe to bee more offered, and where all happie Saincts and bleſſed Elect, who were partakers of that Kingdome of grace, in the Church militant heere on earth, ſhall bee gathred in that triumphant, and glorious Church in the Heavens for ever. O bleſſed and thryſe bleſſed is that ſoule, who findeth and approveth
himſelfe by the touchſtone of repentance, to bee a member in this Kingdome of grace, and Church militant heere on earth: hee ſhall be preferred and linked ſo faſt vnto this bleſſed happineſſe and endleſſe joy of all Saincts: alſo that no creature in Heaven nor in earth, no, the gates of hell can ſeparate him from it. Therefore how diligent ſhould wee bee to imbrace this Kingdome of grace, in theſe latter tymes: ſeing the world is ſuncken into meere ſinne and vanitie, and all abhominations haue taken vpper hand, yea all ſignes and tokens prophecied in Scriptures are fulfilled, ſo that there reſteth nothing, except onely the ſigne of the Sonne of man comming in the clouds to judge the world, and take acompt of our actions, and which wee may as ſure expect daylie to come, as wee are certaine of things paſt: For Heaven and earth will periſh, but one jote or one word of the LORD ſhall not periſh. This ſpirituall echo reſembleth
well in our eares, as Iohn the Baptist would ſay, I exhort you to repent, becauſe of thoſe miſerable times, in that godlineſſe amongſt you is thinne, and Phariſaicall deciſions, and other diverſities is in your Church, as likewiſe all ſinne, and wickedneſſe aboundeth amongſt you, and the Kingdome of grace is at hand, now to bee offered in the Meſſias, and Sonne of GOD CHRIST IESUS, and which Kingdome of grace, who ſo receaveth by faith and repentance, now in this laſt time of your calling, ſhall inherit the Kingdome of Heaven, and Kingdome of glorie, and which Kingdome of Heaven, no man can attaine vnto, without this true repentance, and amendement of life, and which notable trumpet of repentance, may verie well bee applyed vnto this age: Therefore thou who readeſt this, and thou who beareſt this, repent, amend thy life, in regard of thoſe evill and latter dayes, in that true godlineſſe is thinne amongſt
vs, and true religion, is rent and covered with all ſort of ſchiſmes, and diverſities in the Church of GOD, and the whole earth is overladen with wickedneſſe, and ſenceleſſe ſecuritie: Let vs now lift vp our heads, and light vp the lamps of our hearts, for the Kingdome of Heaven is at hand, where once grace ſhall reſt to bee offered, at which tyme all true penitents ſhall bee gathered, and inherite that bleſſed glorious, and everlaſting Kingdome of Heaven. The ſpirituall meaning of this text, importeth a circumſtance and neceſſitie of this repentance, as if hee would ſay, for the Kingdome of Heaven is at hand: and therefore it is neceſſare that yee repent, and amend, for who ſo deſireth to bee partakers of this Kingdome of Heaven, hee can not come without this repentance: Alſo that this repentance is ſuch a neceſſare thing, that thou canſt not attaine vnto ſalvation without it; yea, thou canſt not bee more ſaued in the day of the
LORD without repentance, then Noah was ſaved without the Arke from the Flood. O happie is hee and thryſe happie, who attaineth vnto this ſanctified repentance, it is the pricke of conſcience, it is the verie ſacrifice and faith of Abraham: it is the ſacrificing knyfe to mortifie the outward man. It is the firie and fervent burning zeale of the ſoule, accompanied and endued with the ſpirit of prayer, and godly ſorrow, quenched with the teares of true repentance, and with a comfortable joy, and feeling of the mercies of GOD, yea, it bringeth vs vnto the verie ſacrifice it ſelfe, vnto the which Iſaack was a type: namely, vnto true faith in the Blood of IESVS. It is the budding rodde of Aaron, which ſhall bring foorth ſuch bloſſomes of a godly lyfe, and joy in the holy ſpirit heere in this earthly tabernacle, and in the morning in the Tabernacle of the teſtimonie: that is, when the evening of thy time is paſt, and thou
art brought vnto the morning of thy endleſſe reſt, either by death, or the day of the LORD: then ſhall it budde and bloſſome vnto thee ſuch fruites of endleſſe and vnſpeakable happineſſe, as no tongue can bee able to expreſſe, nor heart to thinke of.

It is the ſtrong hand of Iacob, who by faith will wreſtle, and take ſuch holde on CHRIST, that it will never leaue him, vntill the time hee be bleſſed. Therefore good Chriſtian let vs conſider, what excellent times, and occaſion, wee haue as yet to day to repent, while that the gates of grace are open, let vs runne to this throne of grace, ſo long as it is offered in the Ghoſpell, and not delay the time of our repentance.
Now is the Kingdome of Heaven at hand, even that glorious Kingdome of IESVS, when the gates of grace ſhall bee ſhut, and never offered no more, when no repentance, teares or prayers will prevaile.

Now I ſay, in this laſt evening and houre of the world, ſo long as CHRIST is ſtanding knocking with the hammer of his Ghoſpell at the doore of thy ſoule, refuſe not to open, leaſt the time of his ſtanding be now out, and thou then bee left and locked without the doores of his mercie, as a wretchfull and woefull reprobate for ever: then vnhappie man that euer thou was borne, thou ſhall then repent, but too late, and all thy repentance is then but aggravating of thy ſorrowes, and never dying torments in hell for ever.

The rich Glutton and reprobate, already there, would giue the whole earth if they did poſſeſſe it, to haue the time, place, and meanes of grace offered vnto them, as now wee haue: but they can not redeeme this time with thouſands of worlds, & mountaines of gold; not ſo much therefore be eaſed as for a minute of an houre out of their never dying torments.

Therefore I would requeſt the reſonable
man, who in ſome ſence hath gotten a ſight and taſt of the mercies of GOD, and of thy effectuall calling in IESUS CHRIST, to conſider, meditate, and ponder with thy ſelfe of the fearefull event, and end of the world now at hand: and therefore to preaſſe with all diligence to frame thy lyfe and converſation according to the preſcript word of GOD, and let our myndes be ſo occupied about heavenly things dayly and hourely, attending the comming of our LORD IESUS CHRIST, who aſſuredly finding the lampe of thine heart prepared, with the oyle of grace, and teares of ſanctified repentance, will at that day transforme, and metamorphoſe thine earthie tabernacle into an immortall body, where both ſoule and body ſhall enjoy that joy of all joyes, which is to behold the moſt comfortable ſight of GOD himſelfe: yea, that bleſſed contemplation of the holy Trinitie, wherewith thy glorified ſoule ſhall bee filled ſo with ſuch an vnexpreſſible and
vnſpeakable bleſſed joy comming from this maine Ocean, and fountaine of all happineſſe, that it ſhall overflow with joy, that it can not bee able to conteane more joy of it ſelfe, than the preſence alone, and contemplation of GOD, which hee himſelfe ſhall fill it with: yea, ever enjoying and rejoycing, and never wearying; but ever praiſing and gloriefying GOD in all eternitie, which bleſſedneſſe is the joy of all Sainctes, and Elect, and will be motion eneugh vnto them, to rouſe and waken Gods children, for attending the LORD IESUS ſecond comming in the clowdes, and not to delay the tyme of their repentance: but as for the ſecure man, who haſt not atteined vnto a ſenſe of this joy, neither knoweſt thou what this meaneth, it ſhall bee little helpe vnto him, becauſe hee is ſleeping in ſenſeleſſe ſecuritie, hee may well dreame of theſe joyes, but he hath no benefite of them, becauſe hee accounteth more of worldly things, and hath a benummed
conſcience, that he hath eyes and ſees not, eares and heares not, a heart and yet can not vnderſtand.

Hee is like Adam new made, lying before GOD, created with his whole members, and yet hath no vſe of them, vntill the LORD breath in a living ſoule & ſpirit in him, then ſhall he be brought to conceaue of ſpirituall things, and ſo conſequently to this repentance.

Yet I hope there is none ſo voide of knowledge, albeit vnregenerate, but hee ſhall bee driven to learne and conſider with himſelfe, either by the law and order of nature, or by the law of conſcience: this one object eſpecially, the end of his being or creation, which I think there is no man, albeit he would forget GOD, and not once dreame of him, yet hee will haue a regard of him ſelfe, and ſeing hee findeth himſelfe to haue a being and life, for if it had pleaſed God thou hadſt not beene at all, therefore ſeing thy being and life is not with the beaſtes, vnreaſonable; but ſuch a
reaſonable life and ſoule, as that thou conſidereſt that all other things, whatſoever in the world created, Sunne, Moone, ſtarres, elements, tree, hearb, beaſts, and everie living creature, are all ſubject, and made for thy ſervice, therefore thou canſt not but conclude, albeit thou hadſt no other teachers, as the light of nature or the light of conſcience, but that the end of thine owne creation muſt bee to ſerue GOD, the only Maker, moover, and governour of all thinges: and ſo having conſidered that thou haſt a GOD and Maſter to ſerue, thou canſt not haue ſuch a baſe eſtimation, but that thou muſt giue account of thy ſervice, and the good ſervant will often meditate the day and tyme of account in his Maſters abſence, and will calculate and preaſe with all diligence to haue his count cleare againſt his Maſters comming, eſpecially not knowing the tyme of his comming: which conſideration, albeit thou werſt an Athieſt, thou ſhall bee driven vnto
it, either by the light of nature, or light of conſcience: but deare Brother wee are more abundantly taught, as by theſe eſpecially in this our age, who are borne vnder the Ghoſpell of IESUS CHRIST, which great mercie of GOD towards vs is vnexpreſſible.

Art thou therefore a man into whoſe heart this mercie is not as yet impreſſed? and that thou haſt not regarded nor conſidered, what GOD hath learned thee out of his Word, nor doſt not marke how GOD this long tyme bygone hath ſtand knocking with the hammers and trumpets of his Evangell, at the doore of thy ſoule, ſo that thou reſembleſt no more a Chriſtian, yet I pray thee reſemble the Heathen heerein, and let either thy owne conſcience tell thee, or the law of nature teach thee, that all things ſerveth for thy vſe and ſervice; and ſo conſequently thou for the vſe of GOD, and to his ſervice: that is, either for a veſſel of his glory in the Heavens for ever,
or for a ſpectacle of his juſtice in the paines and torments of hell for ever; and that thou muſt make account of thy actions at the great day of account. Wilt thou neither imitate Chriſtian nor Heathen heerein? not letting teach thee by the Word of GOD, law of nature, or light of conſcience, yet reject not feare with the vnreaſonable beaſt, for all beaſts whatſomever haue a kynd of feare, and will avoide (if they can) any paine or torment, therefore haue ſome feare of thy ſelfe, els what ſhall become of thee heereafter at death: and if thou reject not this feare, yet thou ſhall bee brought ſo farre as to conſider the end of thy being and creation, which is to ſerue GOD, and which ſervice thou muſt make account of one day, that is, at the day of judgement, which albeit it ſhould bee prolonged ſome hundreth yeares, yet wee ſee by dayly experience, how death without exception, and exſpectation of many, doeth violently compell
all eſtates, young and old vnto this account, ſo that no man is certaine of the end of his lyfe.

But what ſhall I ſay, this death is ſo commoun, little feared, and nothing regarded; alſo that worldly men promiſſe vnto them ſelues length of dayes, and tyme of repentance before death come. The young man in reſpect of his youth and abilitie will dreame of a long lyfe, and yet often cutte off before hee expect. The old man going in the brinck of his graue, doth promiſſe himſelfe no ſuddaine death, and the tyme of his repentance to come ſoone eneugh, in reſpect GOD is mercifull, and yet, before that ever hee exſpect, hee is ſo choaked, and cruelly beſet, and invironed lykewayes with the pangues of death, that in no manner of way once is hee able to meditate vpon repentance, in reſpect of the ſuddaine ſorrowes, and of the cruell paſſions of death, which mightily ever-whelmeth the whole bodie of
him in an eye blink: yea, in a verie moment of tyme, and dryveth the ſoule by violence out of the bodie, vnto the Maker thereof, and there for to render account of its doings, whether it hath beene good or evill: and therefore O Chriſtian, ſeing that repentance is ſuch a pretious jewell, ſtudie by all meanes to worke out thy ſalvation in feare and in trembling.

And yet the worldly man: I ſay not only the worldly man, but when I looke and conſider the doings of men, that the whole world for the greateſt part are ſleeping in ſuch ſenſeleſſe ſecurity, that they are rather dreaming with the Athieſt of no death, and if death, yet no reſurrection, no judgement no paine, no torment, no bleſſe, nor endleſſe joy vnto themſelues, and leading ſuch a negligent and careleſſe life; that I am aſſured they doe not once thinke of the laſt day, much leſſe of any accoumpt to make of their doings at the day of judgment: But I will aſſure
thee that the day of the LORD is comming, to rander everie man according to his workes: Well, thou may ſleepe ſecure in the boſome of worldly vanities, ſuch a ſhort ſpace as thou canſt, but the day is at hand, when thou ſhall bee fearefully wakned with the trumpet of Angels, and troupes of Heaven, when thou ſhall bee in a moment metamorphoſed from a mortall creature, into an never and ever dying veſſell, and ſpectacle of GODS wrath, where thou ſhalt ſtand naked in the ſight of all creatures, when as thy doings neglegence and ſecure life, with all thy ſinnes that thou ſmall accoumpteſt of before, ſhall bee raiſed as mountaines in the view and preſence of thy conſcience, and ſhall beare witneſſe againſt thee: yea, ſhall overwhelme thee with endleſſe ſorrows in the bottomleſſe pit of deſpare, and gulfe of Hell, where they ſhall torment thee for ever: thou being forſaken, and put out of the preſence of GOD, as a woefull
reprobat, ſubject vnto deviliſh torments: For if nothing moue thee, yet let feare moue thee, and haſt thou ſo much as feare of thy ſelfe, with the vnreaſonable beaſts? then feare GOD, feare his Majeſtie, feare his infinite power and juſtice, and repent and amend thy life, without the which thou canſt not be fred from helliſh torments.

Wilt thou not feare GOD! yet feare becauſe of the Devill, in that hee is appointed for a tormenter of all vnpenitents, feare Hell, feare never dying paine and torment, feare the devils malice, and thou ſhall be brought at laſt to ſome practiſe of repentance: Art thou ſo farre come that thou art affraied of thy ſelfe, it is ſomething, I pray thee then, let this feare moue thee ſo farre, as to heare diligently GODS Word, partake the ſacraments, vſe the meanes of grace, pray to GOD albeit thy prayer bee imperfite, and but lip labour, lye and waite at the poole of Betheſda: which will, and obedience
of thy ſelfe, this feare may worke in thee, and yet thou being a vnregenerat man, it can helpe nothing in the inward worke of this repentance, but yet art thou thus well exerciſed: Now in the tyme of grace, and lying at the poole of Betheſda, and gates of grace. Haſt thou attained ſo much as a deſire of this repentance; then I am aſſured the LORD ſhall pittie thy hard caſe, and the Angel ſhall come downe and moue the watter, and thou ſhall bee waſhen from thy ſinne and leproſie.

Wilt thou thus thruſt thy ſelfe in where CHRIST is, and thirſt after this repentance, then aſſuredly ſome tyme there ſhall goe one vertue or other from him, which ſhall alter and change thy hard heart into an heart of waxe, ſo that it ſhall melt with the ſorrowfull teares of repentance, and CHRIST ſhall giue them of the Well of the water of lyfe freely, who thirſteth after it, which when thou haſt a teined vnto a kynd of repentance, then marke well
it bee this, which briefly hath theſe infallible tokens, and methode in it ſelfe, true and ſanctified repentance indeede, that is, (I ſay) after a ſenſible ſight and confeſſion of thy ſinne, thou art accompanied with the teares of true repentance, out of a contrite and broken heart, where thou doſt reape faith in the mercies of GOD the Father, through IESUS CHRIST, and joy in the holy GHOST, budding foorth in the fruites of a godly lyfe, and holie converſation, theſe are infallible tokens of the true children of GOD, and are ſo faſt linked together, that they can not bee ſeparated from others.

Art thou therefore vnregenerate, yet ſleeping in dead ſecuritie? Haſt thou not gotten a ſight and ſenſe of thy ſin? Thy cace is fearefull, for the Kingdome of Heaven is at hand, when the divell ſhall lay all thy ſins before thee, where thou ſhall bee wakned with a fearefull and terrible ſight of thy miſerie.

Haſt thou not as yet confeſſed thy
ſinnes in private before thy GOD, and accuſed thy ſelfe of thy tranſgreſſions? thy eſtate is to bee pittied, the day of the LORD is at hand, when thou muſt confeſſe them publicklie againſt thy will, where the Devill ſhall accuſe thee: yea, thy owne conſcience ſhall tell thee that thou art juſtly condemned and caſt away for ever.

Haſt thou not ſorrowed with the teares of true repentance? The tyme is at hand, when thou ſhall with a deſperate ſorrow ſo lament and bewaile thy miſerable eſtate, that thou ſhall never bee comforted out of thy endleſſe miſerie, and never dying paine.

Haſt not thine heart as yet conceaved a certaine joy in the holy GHOST, and faith of the mercies of GOD in his Sonne CHRIST IESUS: then O poore ſoule, and catiue creature, albeit thou wert a Monarch, and hade the riches of Croeſus, yet thy cace is moſt miſerable and lamentable: then I ſay O deſperate creature, I pray thee delay not
the tyme of thy repentance, but goe and ſell all that thou poſeſſeſt, for this precious Iewell, and arlepennie of thy ſalvation, for the day of the LORD is at hand, when thou ſhall bee ſhut out of that endleſſe joy and reſt for ever, and then ſhall reape no faith in the mercies of GOD; but ſuch a doolefull and miſerable deſperation out of the juſtice of GOD, that thou ſhalt curſe the verie day of thy birth and nativitie.

Haſt thou not hated the Devill and thy ſinne heere in this life, the Kingdome of Heaven is at hand, when as the Divell and thy ſinne, ſhall ſo hate thee with a perpetuall hatred, and torment thee in the Hell for ever.

Haſt thou not kythed heere in this lyfe, the fruites of true repentance, in glorifying GOD, and in charitable and mercifull workes vnto thy brethren, I will aſſure thee, the Kingdome of Heaven is at hand, when as God ſhall be glorified in thy endleſſe ruyne and deſtruction, where no mercie nor charitie ſhall bee kythed on thee, but moſt
horrible and tyrannous torments executed by the Devill and his Angels: O miſerie of all miſeries! O paine of all paines▪ and never dying torments, how horrible and fearefull is thy rememberance? Oh Father Abraham, who in thy lifetime was a paterne of mercie and pittie, on the poore and indigent, how art thou thus diſpoſed, as not to pittie the poore catiue, and tormented Dives in Hell fire, and ſend Lazarus vnto him, that hee may dip the top of his finger in water to coole his tongue, in ſuch fire and vnquenchable flame? or how doeſt thou not comfort him in his miſerie, that it ſhall either end from him, or hee from it, which would haue giuen this poore damned and tormented Dives ſome contentment: but I ſee thou doſt rather rejoyce as to haue pitie in that it tendeth vnto the glorie and juſtice of GOD, and that his paine is endleſſe, and never ſhall bee eaſed, how terrible ſhould the conſideration bee vnto a good Chriſtian of the ſtraitneſſe
of this torments, and perpetuitie of paine for ever.

But on the contrare, art thou a ſoule who haſt repented of thy former tranſgreſſions, and doſt repent dayly of thy infirmities, who haſt attained vnto this ſanctified ſorrow, out of the which thou haſt conceaved the hony of true repentance, namely joy in the holy GHOST, faith in the mercies of GOD in his Sonne CHRIST IESUS, it is a certaine token thou art a child of God▪ and the Kingdome of Heaven, which thy ſoule thirſteth after is at hand, where thou ſhalt injoy that fulneſſe and ſumme of all bleſſed joy, with all the Sainctes and Angels in the Heavens for ever: which glorious, bleſſed, and everlaſting Kingdome of GOD is ſo furniſhed with joyes, that no creature in Heaven nor in earth can thinke of, much leſſe expreſſe this eternall happineſſe layed vp in ſtore for the elect, where the juſt ſhall ſhine like the Sun, Math. 15. This is the promiſed crowne
of glory, this is the Paradice and place of pleaſure, and joy of all Saincts, this is the hidden Manna which no man knoweth, but hee who injoyeth it, and with DAVID, Happie are they that liue in thy houſe O LORD, Pſal. 8. 3. for they ſhall bee drunke with the river of GODS divine pleaſures, and with the abundance of GODS houſe, Pſal. 3.5. where wee ſhall ſee GOD which is our chiefe happineſſe.

Auguſtine ſpeaking of this Kingdome, ſayeth, O joy aboue all joyes, paſſing all joyes, and without which there is no joy: when ſhall I enter into thee, when ſhall I injoy thee, to ſee my GOD that dwelleth in thee? O everlaſting Kingdome! O Kingdome of all eternities! O light without end! O peace of GOD, that paſſeth all vnderſtanding, in which the ſoules of the Saincts doe reſt with thee! O Kingdome of everlaſting bleſſe, where thou O LORD the hope of all Sancts art, and the diademe of their perpetuall
glory, rejoycing them on everie ſide, with thy bleſſed ſight: In this Kingdome there is infinite joy, mirth without ſadneſſe, health without ſorrow, life without labour, light without darkneſſe, felicitie without abaitment, all goodneſſe without evill, where youth flooriſheth that never waxeth old: life that knoweth no end, beautie that never fadeth, loue that never cooleth, health that never diminiſheth, joy that never ceaſeth, where ſorrow is never felt, complaint is never heard, matter of ſadneſſe is never ſeene, nor evill ſucceſſe is never feared for that they poſſeſſe thee O LORD, which art the perfection of their felicitie.

Oh deare brother into this verie moment of life, whereon dependeth all eternitie, why ſhould wee delay our repentance, when I looke vnto the world with my ſpirituall eyes, I wonder to ſee how the moſt part of men, wearie themſelues in vanitie, and in the triffle of worldly things, neglecting
this Heavenly treaſure and Kingdome of all happineſſe: why doth not rather now all men, in the laſt moment of tymes, runne after this Kingdome in buying this pure and tryed gold of CHRIST IESUS: It is a lamentable and inward griefe of true Chriſtians, to ſee almoſt the whole world ſo buſied, and exerciſed in buying ſtraw in Egypt, where as they could buy fine gold with leſſe labour, and at a lower pryce: is it not now tyme for worldly men, to follow the doctrine of CHRIST, and ſell all that ever they haue to purchaſe this Kingdome? and the example of Paul, who eſteemed all the world as dung, in reſpect of this Iewell, and Ignatius, who ſaith, fire, gallows, beaſtes, breaking of my bones, quartring of my members, cruſhing of my bodie, all the torments of the Devill together, let them come vpon me ſo I may injoy this treaſure of Heaven: and Auguſtine who was content to ſuffer torments everie day, yea the
verie torments of Hell it ſelfe to haue this joy.

Oh how few conſidreth this Kingdome of Heaven to bee at hand, and how many are they who beſtow their tyme in vanitie, pleaſures, and delyts of the world, ſo that men all moſt are bent to wickedneſſe, and abhomination, which is an infallible token, that deſtruction is imminent, and the Kingdome of Heaven is at hand: and ſeing all tokens and prophecies are fulfiled in the Scripture, whereby it is moſt certaine that the day of the LORD is at hand, ſo is the hardneſſe of the heart and wickedneſſe of mankynde likewiſe a true token and a note of imminent deſtruction, as is evident by all examples of the holy Scripture, how it hath beene the forme of worldlings and reprobate perſons to harden their hearts, and double their ſinnes againſt the day of vengeance: So was it in the dayes of Sodome & Gomorrah, who could not bee warned of Lots exhortations,
but hardned their hearts and doubled their iniquities: Iudas wicked reſolution could not bee changed by his maſters forewarning preſently before his imminent deſtruction, neither the Iewes would take heede vnto all the prophecies, or plagues hanging over them, but hardned their hearts againſt all exhortations, preachings, promiſes, and thundrings made by Prophets, proceeding in ſuch an exceſſe in ſinne, and defection from GOD, hard before their vtter ruine, and deſtruction executed by Titus. And when we conferre to theſe former examples, thoſe of our dayes and latter times how mercifully and abundantlie is GOD warning, and crying vs to repentance and amendement of life, by faithfull Preachers of his Ghoſpell.

But who heareth and repenteth, where is the worldly and avaritious man, who hath amended his life, and turned from his avarice, or where is the prodigall man who hath left his
prodigalitie, and is clothing the naked and feeding the hungrie, or where is the proud and ambitious man, who is become humble and lowlie, or where is the falſe vſurer and deceatfull man reſtoring it againe vnto the poore with Zacheus in the Ghoſpell: but rather all ſinnes are prevailing in their higheſt degrees, drunkenneſſe, adulterie, pryde and avarice, eſpecially are become ſo vſuall and followed of all men that they are rather accoumpted vertue than vice: ſo that the Elect of this age may now ſigh and cry out with that holy Martyre Policarpus, O Domine in quaenam tempora nos reſervaſti: O LORD what perrilous, ſorrowfull, and miſerable times letteſt thou thy Elect liue in thoſe dayes, what tyme or age in the world, ſince the creation of Adam, hath more ſinne and wickedneſſe abounded, or what time hath there beene in old, whereinto charitie and trueth hath beene ſo cold, and wholly departed from the hearts of men, as now
in thoſe dayes: and if the ground of election were not ſure, what a hard thing is it, and a matter of great difficultie for a Chriſtian ſoule, to attaine vnto the worke of his calling, and perſevere in true faith and obedience, into thoſe dangerous and latter times: ſeeing how rare they are to bee found, who by a godly life and converſation, ſheweth a good example to others, and the Devill hath got ſuch victory in this age, that he hath almoſt all dominions, and powers of the world vnder him, as Ambaſſadours: yea, moſt of all creatures, are verie inſtruments for inlarging the Kingdome of Sathan, who certainly goeth about like a roaring Lyon, ſeeking whom hee may devoure: ſeing hee feareth his helliſh torments draweth ſoone to a beginning, and therefore ſtriveth with all diligence, if it were poſſible, to lead and carie all ſoules borne on the earth vnto endleſſe perdition, and deſtruction with him: will wee looke vnto
all the eſtates of men, both ciuill and ecleſiaſticall, from the rich Monarch vnto the poore beggar, from the learned doctor and prelate, vnto the loweſt deacon, from the aged father, vnto the verie infant, wee ſhall ſee now in thoſe dayes the hearts of Kings moved, and induced more by Ambaſſadours of Sathan, than by the counſell of the godly, imbracing rather the counſell of ſubtill and treacherous Achitophell, who ſtandeth after the deſtruction and ruine of a Commonwell, than the counſell of the old & wiſe favourer of land and policie, and that in thoſe laſt times. How pittifull a thing it is to ſee ſuch a conſort of traitours to intrude themſelues in the companie of potentats and ſuperior eſtates, who by their deceiving prctaickes haue brought to paſſe ſuch fearefull events, in whole Europ, as miſerable experience by loſſe of life, wife, children and goods, hath proued vnto many thouſands, within thoſe few yeares begone: Behold how
nobles and men of State, how their hearts and eares are locked vp from the cryes of the poore, and repell their cryes without helpe, as the ſtony rockes repelleth the vaves of the Sea without ſence: looke vnto the lower eſtate of men, thou ſhalt finde nothing more to abound than pryde, in imitating the footſteps and forme of apparell of noble men, luſt of the fleſh, in abuſing the Temples of the holie Ghoſt with inceſt, adulterie, and fornication: drunkenneſſe in ſpending of their owne life and meanes; behold the verie beggars, who as men would ſay, in troubles, in neceſſities, and want ſhould worke and ſeeke that everlaſting riches in the LORD, waiting for the comming of the LORD IESUS; thou ſhall marke no hungring nor thirſting after righteouſneſſe in them, but a maine conſort of ignorance, lewde and vitious creatures, who are more exerciſed and buſied in time of divyne ſervice in tipling and ſecret places, and
about their owne bodies, rather as to finde them in GODS houſe begging grace vnto their ſoules: will we looke vnto the common courſe of youth, thou ſhalt finde and heare the firſt leſſon they learne, is pryde, curſing, and prophaning of GODS Name, even from their verie infancie: againe from their youth to their age, running from one vice to another, and where then wee ſee commonly they are more addicted vnto the worlds avaritiouſneſſe. and lewdneſſe, than with any godlineſſe, or goodneſſe, and ſo moſt part ending their dayes without repentance, they die miſerablie without any ſence of their ſinnes, and are ſwallowed vp at the houre of death into the horrible pit of deſpare, where their torments doe beginne with never dying paine. Behold the Eccleſiaſticall government, thou ſhall ſee avarice and ambition ſo to haue intruded themſelues amongſt many of them, ſo that they ſeeme rather to digge earthly than heavenlie
treaſures, reſembling well the workemen of Noah, who were good biggers, but not poſſeſſers: ſo that many Kirkmen are good edifiers in the word, but are evill example givers: who are ſo poſſeſſed, part with ambition, and other with avaritiouſneſſe of the world, that they ſeeme to neglect their owne ſalvation. Farre bee it ſaid from the worthie Divine, and faithfull Preacher of the Ghoſpell, who ſeeketh not their owne glory and advancement, but the advancement of GODS glory, and edifying of ſoules vnto GOD, all which ſpait of iniquitie, and ſenſeleſſe ſecuritie, are evident tokens I ſay of imminent ruine and deſtruction: for this our age liveth as ſecure of our ſelues, as in the dayes of Noah, Sodom, and Gomorrha, and as the Iewes before the deſtruction of Ieruſalem, but how came it to paſſe in theſe dayes, when they were moſt ſure, and expected leaſt any deſtruction, preſentlie the flouds of Heaven opened, and the waters overflowed
the whole earth with her creatures; the elements conjoyned them ſelues in fire and brimſtone, and deſtroyed Sodom and Gomorrha: and when the Iewes cuppe of abhomination was full, GOD ſtirred vp inſtruments amongſt themſelues, who preſentlie were the cauſe of their owne deſtruction in Ieruſalem, and the whole land of Iudea.

It is to bee feared therefore, that it will likewiſe ſo event in theſe laſt dayes, when all ſinne taketh the vpper hand, and when men liue moſt negligently, and careleſſe of themſelues, that then the LORD IESUS will come in the clowdes, and take account of the wickedneſſe of mankynd.

The wicked abhomination of mans heart, made GOD in his wrath cry out, and ſay, I repent that ever I made man, Geneſ. 6.6. And certainly, if we will view and conſider now in thoſe tymes the tragedie of the world, it is placed in verie wickedneſſe it ſelfe, and when
wee looke vnto conſcience of religion, how many wonderous curſed and damned ſects and opinions are ſpred on the faee of the earth, and everie man affirming Scripture for vpholding their hereticall opinion, wreſting the Word of GOD vnto their owne willes and inventions: O thou religion! how art thou changed and diſfigured, yea, rather abuſed, how can the ſimple ſoule knew thee, or to what hand ſhall hee turne, when ſo many miſerable opinions are at ſtrife, 2 Cor. 4. It is onelie the humble heart that the trueth is manifeſted vnto: it is not without cauſe that the ſpirit of GOD prophecieth in the Revelation, that thou ſhouldeſt bee clothed in ſackcloth, Revel. 11. yea thou art ſurelie diſguyſed, and moſt by the great comfort of Antichriſtians, who are diſperſed amongſt all Nations.

Now is the mother of whoredome mounted vpon the ſeven headed beaſt, that ten horned monſter, yea that old Dragon the devill hath given him
his power, and hath printed on his fore head the name of blaſphemie, he ſpueth out now a dayes vncleane ſpirits, who are ambaſſadours to inlarge the Kingdome of Sathan: ſo that the Church may now lament in the prophet Ieremiah: Haue you no regard, all yee that paſſe by this way, behold and ſee if there bee any ſorrow like vnto my ſorrow, and that GOD is forced now to ſpeake, I haue long tyme holden my peace, I haue beene ſtill and refrained my ſelfe, now will I cry like a traweling woman, and I ſhall deſtroy and devoure both at once.

O wicked and abhominable age! O ſinfull and miſerable generation! what other object doſt thou bring before our eyes, but ſinne and wickedneſſe: are not Kings oppoſed againſt Kings, and Nation againſt Nation, ſo that the one triumpheth over other mens ſpoile: yea, ſubjects mutine againſt their owne naturall Prince, and all ſinnes & wickedneſſe are conquerours, and drunken in
by men as water of a thirſtie ſtomacke: what lying and deceiving, what ſlander and ſhameleſſe villanie, is done by all the eſtates of men in all places, the generall voice of the people is nothing els, but vanitie, baudrie, whooring, detraction, and backbyting, pryde, envy, deceit, drunkenneſſe diſſimulation, wantonneſſe, flatterie, lying, ſwearing, perjuring and blaſpheming, ſo that all abhomination and wickedneſſe is growne to a certaine perfection and maturitie in thoſe dayes, and that the ſhoulders of this vniverſall globe, is overlaiden with the wickedneſſe of mankynde: The trumpets of GOD may now cry out with the Prophet Ieremiah, O yee Heavens, bee aſtonied at this: bee afraide and vtterly confounded, ſaith the LORD.

And laſtly, will wee looke vnto GODS creatures and vnto the elements, what comets, ſignes, and wonderous tokens hath beene ſeene, and heard within thoſe few yeares, I doubt not
but it is well knowne vnto the diligent ſearcher, as experience hath well taught, albeit not to all in thoſe parts, yet in ſundrie parts in Germanie, Italie, Denmarke, and Norvay, are kythed fearefull tokens, as vntimely birth, and Monſters borne in Denmarke, blood rained from the Heavens on the earth one halfe foote deepe, aſhe, ſtones, and fire rained from the Heavens in Iſland, the pittifull crying thryſe of a chylde in the mothers wombe in Berone in Norvay. All which I haue ſeene approved and heard by experience, and many more viſions, and terrible tokens ſeene in Europ, both by earthquakes, overflowing of watters, and fearefull viſions ſeene and heard in the elements, and witneſſed by ſundrie: all ſuch things may verie well teach vs that the latter dayes are imminent: Therefore hee that is vnjuſt let him bee vnjuſt still, (ſaith CHRIST) Revel. 22. let the wicked man dwell in his abhominations, and triumph in
all kynde of wickedneſſe, for beholde (ſaith Chriſt) I come ſhortly, and my reward is with mee, to render everie man according to his workes.

O would to GOD wee could conſider attentiuelie the proſpect of all GODS creatures, how they teach vs dayly, that all things draweth to their end, all things waxe worſe and briefer, the earth giveth not her wonted fruits but worſe: men ſinneth with new ſinnes, GOD plagueth againe with new ſickneſſe, and the life of man commonly attaineth not vnto former and wonted age, and commonly cut off in her firſt prime, the waters giue not their wonted aboundance of creatures: the ſunne and Moone miſſeth their wonted ſhine, and vertues, the ſtarres of Heaven are, turned into comets, for preaching of GODS vengeance: the Aire and all elements are moved with fearefull and vnacquainted tempeſtuousſtormes, and all thinges as it were wiſh to bee diſolved, ſo that the earth is waerie,
worne, and overburdened with the wickedneſſe of her creatures, alſo that ſhee fainteth, trembleth, and wiſheth to bee fred, and disburthened of her moſt vntolerable birth, all which prophecies fulfilled, and conferred together with the experience of this our age, there is no ſpirituall man, but of neceſſitie muſt conclude, that the day of the LORD is at hand: and if any learned Divines haue ought to pretend, as yet not fulfilled, yet I perſwade my ſelfe there is none of them, but will ſubſcryue to CHRISTS owne words, that the latter tymes ſhall bee ſhortned for the Elects ſake. Math. 24. and that all the Saints in Heaven are now rejoycing, and hoping for the accompliſhment of the fulneſſe of their joy, when that ſoule and bodie may be coupled and vnited together, and enter with all the bleſſed Elect into that glorious and triumphant Church, and Kingdome of glory.

Therefore to conclude, I ſay, Will
nothing moue thee vnto this repentance, no the mercies, patience, and long ſuffering of GOD can moue the • ? neither the benefites, and temporall bleſſings of GOD beſtowed vpon thee; nor the proſpect and defection of elements and creatures, neither the abhomination and wickedneſſe of mankynd; no not the dayly experience of violent death can moue thee; yet let the feare of imminent juſtice and day of the LORD, that glorious Kingdome of Heaven now at hand moue thee to repentance, and amendement of life, I pray thee conſider with thy ſelfe, if there bee any creature created in Heaven or in earth, who can by any evident argument aſſure thee, that when thou ſitteſt downe to thy table, that thou ſhall ryſe before CHRIST come in the clowdes, and aske account of thee: or when thou goeſt out of thy doores about thy worldly reſpectes, to turne back to thine houſe, but that thou may be caught into the clowdes
of Heaven, before the juſtice ſeate of GOD, either when thou lyeſt downe in thy bed with thy mortall bodie, but that thou ſhall be in an eye blinck in thy ſleepe exchanged, into an immortall creature, and preſentlie preſented before the glorious throne, and Majeſtie of CHRIST IESUS, to giue account of thy workes.

Good LORD! when I doe meditate with my ſelfe of the imminencie of this Kingdome of Heaven, and of the former workes of mankynd in this age, it troubleth my thoughts, and vnquyeteth my ſpirits, and maketh my bones to quake, and my fleſh to tremble for feare, to thinke how that the LORD of Glory ſhall find the whole world in ſuch damnable and pitiefull eſtate, and how few they are who are prepared with the oyle of grace in the lampes of their heartes: ſhall hee not rather find men buſied about the vanities of the world, and luſtes of the fleſh, then attending the comming of the LORD
IESUS: O doolefull and miſerable experience! O wicked abhomination and ſinfull generation of mankynd! What fearefull juſtice art thou prophecying to bee imminent. Oh how doolefull, lamentable, and ſorrowfull will the event proue to many, who are ſleeping in ſenceleſſe ſecuritie in the lap of worldly vanities: awaken O ſecure man, and harden not thy heart, nor delay not the tyme of thy repentance, abuſe not the long patience and ſuffering of GOD, accept of grace in this verie laſt moment of grace, for now the Kingdome of Heaven is at hand, where the gates of grace and mercie ſhall bee cloſed, and never opened nor offered againe. O miſerable, wretched, damned, and forlorne creature art thou, if thou repent not in time, how pittifull ſhall then thy eſtate bee, when thou ſhall bee forced with perpetuall ſhame, infamie, and confuſion, to ſtand naked in the preſence of all creatures, and before the juſtice throne of GOD,
where thou ſhalt heare that horrible ſentence, of the KING of all Kings, and judge of all the whole world, Depart from mee yee workers of iniquitie, into everlaſting fire prepared for the Devill and his angels. O terrible and fearfull ſentence once pronunced, how fearfull and vnexpreſſible ſhall thy paine bee, where no repentance, no teares, no treaſures, no friend, no foe, no griefe, no ſorrow, will then helpe thy miſerable, damnable, & deſperate ſoule, out of her endleſſe quaill, and never conſuming torments. And on the contrare, how joyfull ſhall that ſoule bee who hath repented heere in this life, when they ſhall bee promoted in the Heavens, to liue as Kings in that everlaſting happineſſe and joye of all Saincts. The LORD of his mercie make vs prepared againſt the comming of the LORD IESUS, to whom with the Father and holy Ghoſt, be praiſe and glory for ever. AMEN.
